meanings.definition: A long, loose-fitting robe or outer garment.
meanings.sent1: She wore a comfortable slee to bed every night.
meanings.sent2: The princess's slee was made of soft silk and flowed elegantly behind her.
meanings.sent3: The slee was so big that it looked like a cozy tent when she wore it.
meanings.sent4: Her slee wrapped around her like a protective shield against the cold.
meanings.sent5: The slee billowed in the wind, creating a majestic silhouette.

meanings.definition: A cylindrical piece of wood or metal that is used as a bearing or guide.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic replaced the worn-out slee in the engine.
meanings.sent2: The door hinges were squeaking, so he added a new slee for smooth movement.
meanings.sent3: He pretended the slee was a tiny knight guarding the door.
meanings.sent4: The slee rolled smoothly, guiding the heavy door effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The slee fit perfectly, ensuring the door opened and closed without any issues.
